newsitem.title: FRANCE: MOTOR RACING-PANIS PLANS COMEBACK THIS SEASON.
newsitem.headline: MOTOR RACING-PANIS PLANS COMEBACK THIS SEASON.

text.p: Frenchman Olivier Panis, who broke both legs when he crashed in the Canadian Grand Prix 11 days ago, hopes to be back in Formula One racing this year.

"I'm going to race before the end of the season," Panis told a news conference on Thursday at a rehabilitation centre in Douarnenez on the Brittany coast where he has been since leaving hospital in Montreal and flying home to France on Tuesday.
Panis, looking pale and sitting in a wheelchair, said he was giving himself two to 2-1/2 months for a comeback.
"I want to win races, from this year I hope. My goal remains to be world champion," he said, adding that the accident in Canada would make him stronger.
"I remember the accident, I never lost consciousness. That's what helps my morale today," the 30-year-old driver said of his first crash during competition.
Panis said his comeback would be a decision made by the team, currently at Magny Cours for Sunday's French Grand Prix.
"I remain in contact with the engineers to stay in touch with all the progress on the car and to be ready to return," he said.
Doctors said Panis should be walking within a month but would not say how long they thought he would be at the rehabilitation centre altogether.
